For NPR News, I'm Sarah Harris in Canton, New York.
Can anyone forget that insane, action-packed chase through the dried up LA River?
Arnold Schwarzenegger's Terminator rescues the child, John Connor, on his motorcycle.
(SOUNDBITE OF FILM, ""TERMINATOR 2: JUDGMENT DAY"")
They're running from a cyborg dressed as a cop.
(SOUNDBITE OF FILM, ""TERMINATOR 2: JUDGMENT DAY"")
(As The Terminator) T-1,000 - advanced prototype, a mimetic polyalloy, liquid metal.
That role - the emotionless, unstoppable T-1,000 - made Robert Patrick's career.
He always dreamed of becoming an actor.
But working as a house painter in Cleveland made Hollywood seem like a long shot, until a boating accident that nearly ended his life.
Robert Patrick was sailing with friends on Lake Erie when a storm hit.
Standing there watching the nose of this boat going under water, and within seconds there was nothing.
I grabbed a life preserver, and I started throwing out everything that I could see that would float.
Some of the guys grabbed onto the stuff.
And then I remember, I'm going to swim.
I've got a life preserver.
I'll go, and I was about three miles off the coast of Cleveland.
I was way out there.
It took me three hours to swim in.
By doing that, saved the other guys that were out there 'cause they were all headed to Canada, you know?
That single incident made me stand up and realize if you don't hurry up and do something quick with your life, it can be snatched away.
So he quit his job, packed up his car and headed west in search of a big break.
Bruce Springsteen ""Born In The USA"" record had come out, and I had a cassette of that I slammed in my tape deck, and that sort of fueled the trip across the country.
And there was a song I kept listening to on that record, ""No Surrender."" And this was a last desperate attempt to give purpose to my own life, getting into this business.
(SOUNDBITE OF SONG, ""NO SURRENDER"")
(Singing) Well, now young faces grow sad and old and hearts of fire grow cold.
We swore blood brothers against the wind...
Listening to Springsteen - I think I had a huge American flag with me and a sleeping bag and a phone answering machine and a bag of clothes, but, you know, not much.
(SOUNDBITE OF SONG, ""NO SURRENDER"")
(Singing) No retreat, baby, no surrender.
I got an apartment in Koreatown, and I had a view of the Hollywood sign.
I would sit there and look at that Hollywood sign and - all right, you're here.
Let's make something happen.
I got a call saying Jim Cameron is doing a new ""Terminator"" movie.
You are going to create an intense presence.
That's your mission - you know, that's the audition.
That's what you're going to do.
Go.
I walked in.
I said let me turn my back to the camera and just roll on me.
And I did this sort of snap back around and looked right into the lens of the camera.
And I slowed everything down as intense as I could, with everything I had, man.
And it was that moment that - I'd been told - Jim leaned back and went whoa, what's that?
The next day was, of course, a screen test.
And I walked into Jim, into his office - and he had glasses on.
He was sitting at his desk.
And I placed the script down in front of him.
And he kind of looked up at me, and I just went I can do this.
And he said that's why you're here, Robert.
And we did the screen test, and I got the role.
(SOUNDBITE OF FILM, ""TERMINATOR 2: JUDGMENT DAY"")
(As T-1000/Officer X) Are you the legal guardian of John Connor?
(As Janelle Voight) There was a guy here this morning looking for him, too.
(As Todd Voight) Yeah, a big guy on a bike.
Has that got something to do with this?
(As T-1000/Officer X) I wouldn't worry about him.
Perfect timing, it was the right role.
That's the big break.
(SOUNDBITE OF FILM, ""TERMINATOR 2: JUDGMENT DAY"")
(As The Terminator) Come with me if you want to live.
Go.
You can fail, and I failed quite a few times.
But - and you've got to find faith in something.
If you don't, you're going to live a life where I wish I would've.
I'm not living that life of I wish I would've.
I'm living the life that I wanted to live, and that's the satisfaction that I carry with me every day.
Actor Robert Patrick.
He went on to star in ""The X-Files,"" HBO's ""True Blood"" and he played Johnny Cash's dad in ""Walk The Line."" Catch him in the season premiere of ""Scorpion"" Monday on CBS.
The spread of Ebola in West Africa has also had a major effect on wildlife in the area.
The virus can infect gorillas and chimps, and some researchers are now developing a vaccine to prevent Ebola's spread among the animals.
I spoke to one of those researchers, Peter Walsh of the University of Cambridge.
And I asked him, with all the human suffering caused by Ebola why he was working on a vaccine for the animals.
Well, actually gorillas and chimpanzees are one of the major intermediate hosts for Ebola transmission from - we think bats is the reservoir to humans.
Our best guess at this point is that both bats and gorillas and chimpanzees eat fruit.

So what's probably happening is that bats are going to a fruiting, then the gorilla comes along, eat some of the fruit, gets infected itself, infects its family and infects the neighboring community of gorillas.
And then there's a bunch of dead gorillas on the ground, and the local villagers eat the meat, and then they get infected, and then you start one of these outbreaks.
So how bad is Ebola as a problem for apes in Africa?
Now, sending them elsewhere, meaning staff, ad money.
Where's it going?
Currently, about a third of Davidson's 1,700 students receive financial aid, a package of grants, employment and loans.
A few years ago the school began cutting back the limit on loans, first to $5,000 a year, and then to $3,000.
So the new policy could ultimately save students $12,000 over their college career.
Vagt says the decision started as a moral choice, but it wouldn't have succeeded without support from the Board of Trustees.
